lead_paragraph: Óscar Pereiro received the winner’s yellow jersey from the 2006 Tour de France yesterday. “Finally, we have a winner, and it’s Óscar,” said Christian Prudhomme, the Tour director, at a ceremony in Madrid. “Óscar, you have won the Tour out on the road.”Pereiro, a Spaniard, moved to first from second after the disqualification of Floyd Landis for doping. “I have the feeling of arriving at the end of a thriller, after having spent 14 months thinking about it and not being able to concentrate as I should have on my job,” Pereiro said. “The moment I received the profit of my work, I had mixed feelings, something between satisfaction and regret for what we were deprived of.”.
